pr_title: Moving FIS network calls onto a separate executor

timeline.message: Dropping guava and appcompat dependency from FIS SDK.
Moving FIS network calls onto a separate executor

timeline.bodyText: please give this a better name
timeline.author: fredquintana

replies.bodyText:
If possible I would recommend to always start a method name with a verb.
Also please remove the "fis" prefix:
a) "fis" is not a public term (so rather use "firebaseInstallations")
b) it's noise (we are in a class that is called FirebaseInstallations)
If you prefer your current name over the suggested ones, then I recommend to update it like this:
#sendNetworkCall
#makeNetworkCall
replies.author: andirayo

timeline.bodyText:
just realized, we need to be a little careful, here.
If the subsequent call has a different value for "forceRefresh" then we need to be sure that it gets enqueued, otherwise the flag value can get lost.
timeline.author: fredquintana

replies.bodyText:
the force refresh values come from the main thread and will be added on to the network executor. I dont see how the flag gets lost/ overwritten.
@fredquintana wdyt can go wrong?

private final ExecutorService backgroundExecutor;
timeline.author: andirayo

timeline.bodyText:
Q1: Why is this not injected like all the other variables and created by the other constructor method?
Q2: Is there a reason that we have different ways how backgroundExecutor and networkExecutor are initialized?
timeline.author: andirayo

replies.bodyText:
Q2: Idea was to simplify the creation but changed it now to replicate the backgroundExecutor. Reasoning: we had a bug reported by some internal team that checks for thread tags and has whitelisted only firebase-installations-executor.
Q1: The network executor is an impl detail specific to FIS. Adding multiple executors in the constructor could lead to the confusion. I dont see how we can benefit from initializing through injection.
replies.author: ankitaj224

timeline.bodyText:
Executors.newCachedThreadPool() would be good here.
If you choose to explicitly create it, please document the constants.
timeline.author: fredquintana

replies.bodyText:
As mentioned earlier, reason for explicitly creating is some 1p apps restrict creating unnamed thread pools. We got the ThreadFactory created in FIS whitelisted.
Refer to b/148952570
I documented the constants.

timeline.bodyText:
Do I read this correctly?
0L Milliseconds is the timeout time?
Questions and Notes:

Can we use the same numbers that we use for the backgroundExecutor?
Please create constants and use them for both executors
Why is the core pool size different to the other executor?
timeline.author: andirayo

replies.bodyText:
0L is the keep alive time - when the number of threads is greater than the core, this is the maximum time that excess idle threads will wait for new tasks before terminating.
Created constants that are shared between the two executors.
